# Positive Continuous

## Gamma Regression

The response variable is continuous and positive.
In gamma regression, the coefficient of variation is constant rather than the variance.
$$
y_i \sim \dgamma(\alpha_i, \beta)
$$
and
$$
\begin{aligned}[t]
\alpha_i &= \mu_i / \beta \\
\mu_i &= \vec{x}_i \vec{\gamma}
\end{aligned}
$$

In Stan,

-   `gamma(y | alpha, beta)` with shape parameter $\alpha > 0$ and inverse
    scale parameter $\beta > 0$. Then $\E(Y) = \alpha / \beta$ and
    $\Var(Y) = \alpha / \beta^2$.
